data.title: Civil War Walking Tour
data.text: This is a very good tour and it's free!!  There is so much of our nation's history in South Carolina and this is a fun place to start.  We enjoyed the walk and reading about each piece of America's History.

data.title: Just great! Very informative.
data.text: I thought it was a great value, took about 2 hours, never felt like we were being rushed, Mike (the guide) took his time , answered questions, had amusing and enlightening stories about the war and the people. Glad we went, will sign up for historic home tours in the near future.

data.title: Excellent Before and After
data.text: Jack's use of period pictures made the walk worth while but be prepared to walk. It was nearly two hours long and we covered a lot of distance. We lost nearly the whole group along the way, but we are really into history so we hung in there till the end. Charleston is so fortunate to have so many pre-Civil War buildings still in existence. We enjoyed it but it's best of you're a history buff.

data.title: Very informative and interesting
data.text: There were 4 of us and we all learned something new.  Our guide was wonderful; spoke off the cuff, nothing scripted (or he was a great actor).  You could tell he was passionate about the subject.  The time flew by.

data.title: Informative tour
data.text: Really enjoyed the tour.  Even I, a History major, learned a lot about Charleston's side of the Civil War.  The guide brings along old pictures of different areas of Charleston, and it is really neat to compare then and now.

data.title: Reliving the Civil War history of Charleston
data.text:
My husband and I arrived in Charleston on Saturday April 14th and we had pre-booked the Civil War Walking Tour for 9:30 a.m. Sunday morning.  We met with our guide John Young at Washington Park.  This was the beginning of a fascinating and informative two and a half hour walk around the historic district of Charleston.  John brought us to old cemeteries, churches and mansions of the rich, the famous, the political leaders and shared the stories of a heroic slave during the blockade of Charleston Harbor.  With a wealth of knowledge about the early colony as well as the Civil War era, John interspersed the factual history with anecdotes which have been passed down over the years.  
As a teacher in the middle school school grades, I feel a better understanding of the "Confederate side of the story" and the losses the south suffered as a result of this devastating war.  I would definitely suggest taking this tour which is available on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  Other reviewers have taken this tour with Alan and it seems that either of these presenters will provide you with a well-spent morning.

data.title: Brought Civil War history alive for me!
data.text: As a history major I wanted to absorb this tour, learn and interact.  All was possible.  I was lucky enough to get a solo tour and found Alan to be not only knowledgeable, but insightful and personable.  No question was too mundane or elementary.  Slow down; take time to walk the streets of your history and be amazed by things you would never have learned otherwise.

data.title: Wonderful Civil War Tour
data.text: My wife and I visited Charleston during the 4th of July week and booked the tour with Alan, our guide, a few weeks in advance.  The tour started in Washington Park and took us by foot around the city, to the wharf streets and back.  In between Alan was a wealth of information about Charleston during the Civil War period.  I would recommend this tour to anyone who has an interest in Civil War history.  The only change I would make would be to do it outside the summer months.  Two and a half hours walking Charleston in July wore us out.  Even so it was the highlight of the trip for my wife.  Outstanding time spent.

data.title: A Good Investment
data.text: My boyfriend and I spent a fantastic two and a half hour walking tour in June with Alan. We had requested that he shape the tour with Civil War history as its focus and Alan definitely delivered. The tour was at a reasonable pace (we're both in our fifties) and very logically laid out. Alan also brought along a book with illustrations/maps to help us understand the topic. Alan is a genuinely nice person who obviously loves his topic. And to top it all off, he spent a good 10 minutes going over lunch options with us. We took his suggestion to eat at Jestine's, a local eatery and it was great. So, in a nutshell, if you want a well-considered tour from a truly nice person, we can definitely recommend Alan.

data.title: Good historical information
data.text: Enjoyed the history on the city during the Civil War, especially the pictures of each site during that era.  Good way to start a trip to the city.  Our group was 7 people - not crowded.

data.title: Very informative walking tour
data.text: I felt Alan did a good job mixing in big information with many little known facts or stories. It was some of these little known tidbits that seemed to make the tour, and give it a very personal feel. I would use his company again if I was in the area.

data.title: Alan was extremely informative, the tour was well-paced, and the information was presented in a relaxed,pleasant way.
data.text: Because April 12 was such an an historic day, Alan was accompanied by his mother and another tour guide named Syd.  Alan's knowledge and style of presentation were phenomenal, and he did not need help, BUT considering the significance of 4/12/11, the presence of additional guides made the tour even more special.  Alan's pace of walking and talking were just right, so the participants were really able to enjoy the tour. His notebook of pictures added a special touch.  We would definitely use your tour company again.

data.title: Exploring "Hidden" Charleston
data.text: This is a great tour if you want to see "behind the scenes" and see things that you're not likely to see anywhere else.  Alan's knowledge of Charleston's Civil War history is as vast as his access to unique Charleston landmarks is unique.  He not only knows what happened but why it happened, too.  More importantly, he combines that uniquie knowledge with phenomenal access to sites with historical importance.  With him as my guide, I gained access to a part of Chareston's 17th century fortifications after descending through a trap door in a local business.  I've read a lot about the Civil War and Fort Sumter yet still learned a lot on this tour.  I strongly recommend it to anyone with an interest in history or who can appreciate a fascinating story well told.

data.title: The knowledge of the guide was incredible
data.text: On Friday, December 28th, the family took yet another tour of Charleston/Savannah.  This Civil War walking tour was by far the most provocative and interesting.  The guide's historic knowledge lent each of us a perspective and a feeling that made us step back 140 years.  He was excellent, enthusiastic and exciting.  Great tour

data.title: Best Tour We Went On!!
data.text: We went on many tours during our vacation to the area and this was by far the best tour!  I am not even really interested in the Civil War and just went for my husband's sake, but I had such a good time! Our guide was incredible - he knew everything there was to know about the war and the role Charleston played. He told us things you can't find in history books and really presented the facts from a purely impartial view. He was also able to draw many parallels between that time and modern day. You really have to use your imagination to visualize some of the stories, but what do you expect - it's 150 years later!  This tour is worth your time and the price! Expect to spend about 2 hours, but they will fly by and leave you wanting more!

data.title: Helemaal prima!
data.text: Interessante tour, gids wist veel te vertellen, maakte de stadshistorie en zijn huidige positie veel begrijpelijker en interessanter! Aan te raden...
